concat.scalar:
If you buy a brand new device again, it will come only with 90 days of free technical support, after that you will still have to extend the support and this will be a double time investment for you, but here you already own a router and you are just paying for the support.
Even a new device is going to cost you money & that will also come with a limited support,

so once your support expires again you will end up paying for technical support, so if you practically calculate you will be paying two charges. Since the HW is working well, so rather than buying a new device, you can stick with this device & have your support extended, where you can take advantage for each & every device in your home.

I understand that you are thinking of having the product replaced. I had done a complete HW check to get a better understanding of the situation. Based on that, I could see that there is no defect on the device you have. It is not the device, which is causing a problem, it’s a minor issue that is causing the problem which we can try to rectify today.

The problem you are facing now can happen on any device you purchase. What I would suggest you is to get the issue resolved rather than replacing a device which is already perfectly working.

We can also suggest you to buy a new router from itself but no point of changing the router when you already have a good one, Only the phone technical support has expired where you once renew it,
we can try to fix the issue in the same phone call.
I can see that you already have a valid tech support, so you don't need to pay anything.

concat.scalar: **Searching for query:**

Even if you buy a brand-new device, it will come only with 90 days/limited time of free technical support. After that, it will happen for you to extend the support and which will be a double time investment for you, but here, you already own a router and you are just paying for the support.

strictly follow business policy so not only most of the brands you buy in the market will be following similar policy.
It’s a minor issue (glitch) that is causing the problem. The problem you are facing now can happen on any device you purchase. What I would suggest you is to get the issue resolved rather than replacing a device which is already perfectly working one.

One thing I would like to address is that, it doesn’t matter which brand of router you purchase in the market, you will only get a limited period of free support. After that, its paid support. Moreover, you will only get support on the router / adaptor. But here, we provide support on all your home networking products irrespective of brand or manufacturer.
I would suggest you go ahead and extend the support and enjoy the service.
I can see that you have a valid technical support, so I can help you if you are facing any issues with your device without any charge.
